    • By directly passing the frequency tuning parameters (INTE, FRAC, and VCO_CNT) with the command, certain internal computational steps are avoided and the tuning speed of the hop is improved (compared to simply re-issuing a START_RX command with the new desired channel number). The values entered for these parameters should describe the desired RX channel center frequency (i.e., not the shifted RX LO frequency).
    • Any arbitrary frequency (within the same band) may be tuned with this command; there is no requirement for the frequencies to fall on increments of a given channel spacing. However, the same output divider setting (as set in the MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND property) is used for all frequencies, and thus the tuned frequencies may not span across an output divider band break.
    • This command is typically issued while already in RX mode and will cause the chip to hop to the frequency specified by the parameters and start searching for a Preamble.
    • The VCO_CNT parameter is required to support calibration of the VCO at each tuned frequency. This is normally a parameter that is internally calculated by the chip; however, that internal computation requires time and thus hop speed may be improved by pre-calculating and passing this parameter from the host MCU. Please contact Silicon Labs Support for assistance with calculation of the VCO_CNT values.
  • Argument Stream:
    RX_HOP Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x36
    0x01 INTE INTE
    0x02 FRAC 0 0 0 0 FRAC[19:16]
    0x03 FRAC[15:8]
    0x04 FRAC[7:0]
    0x05 VCO_CNT VCO_CNT[15:8]
    0x06 VCO_CNT[7:0]

  • Reply Stream:
    RX_HOP Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • INTE
      • INTE
        Description:
        • This parameter defines the integer portion of the total divide number for the Fractional-N PLL Synthesizer.
        • Please refer to the text description for FREQ_CONTROL_INTE for more details regarding frequency calculation.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0x7f
    • FRAC
      • FRAC
        Description:
        • This parameter defines the fractional portion of the total divide number for the Fractional-N PLL Synthesizer.
        • Please refer to the text description for FREQ_CONTROL_INTE for more details regarding frequency calculation.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x80000
        Max:
        0xfffff
    • VCO_CNT
      • VCO_CNT
        Description:
        • This parameter defines the target count required by the VCO Calibration algorithm.
        Type:
        U16
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xffff
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

READ_RX_FIFO

  • Number: 0x77
  • Summary: Reads data byte(s) from the RX FIFO.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip provides for two separate 64-byte FIFO memories for the purpose of storing transmit and receive data. (When the GLOBAL_CONFIG:FIFO_MODE bit is set, these two FIFOs are combined into a single 129-byte shared FIFO.)
    • This command is used to read data byte(s) from the RX FIFO. The READ_RX_FIFO command should be clocked in on SDI and the reply should be clocked out on SDO without deasserting NSEL. If you read more data bytes than the RX FIFO contains it will generate a FIFO Underflow interrupt event.
    • This command does not cause CTS to go low, and can be sent while CTS is low. This command has no response to be read and thus there is no need to monitor CTS after sending this command.
  • Argument Stream:
    READ_RX_FIFO Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x77

  • Reply Stream:
    READ_RX_FIFO Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210

  • Argument Fields:
  • Reply Fields:

ADVANCED_COMMANDS

GET_ADC_READING

  • Number: 0x14
  • Summary: Performs conversions using the Auxiliary ADC and returns the results of those conversions.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip provides an Auxiliary Analog-to-Digital Converter (ADC) for the purpose of measuring various analog parameters and returning their values in digital form. The ADC utilizes a Successive Approximation Register (SAR) architecture and achieves 11-bit resolution, with a 9-bit Effective Number of Bits (ENOB).
    • The ADC may be configured to measure the internal battery voltage, an internal temperature sensor, or an external voltage applied to a selected GPIO pin. More than one type of measurement may be enabled at the same time; the conversions will be performed sequentially and all converted values returned.
    • The ADC is capable of converting any battery voltage within the chip's operating supply voltage range of 1.8VDC to 3.6VDC.
    • The GPIO pin carrying the external voltage to be measured is selected by the ADC_GPIO_PIN parameter, and must also be configured as an input pin or tri-state pin (through the GPIO_PIN_CFG command).
    • The voltage on the selected GPIO pin may be internally attenuated prior to conversion, thus effectively extending the range of voltages which may be converted. The attenuation factor is configurable through the GPIO_ATT parameter.
  • Comments (internal):
    • The chip returns values for the slope and intercept of the TEMP_degC-vs-TEMP_ADC equation. These values are not calculated by the chip, but simply return the corresponding values (stored in OTP variable space) as part of the GET_ADC_READING reply stream. In this fashion, the OTP_VARS_AUXADC_TEMP_SLOPE and OTP_VARS_AUXADC_TEMP_INTERCEPT parameters provides a means for factory calibration of the temperature sensor performance, if desired.
  • Argument Stream:
    GET_ADC_READING Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x14
    0x01 ADC_EN 0 0 0 TEMPERATURE_EN BATTERY_VOLTAGE_EN ADC_GPIO_EN ADC_GPIO_PIN
    0x02 ADC_CFG UDTIME GPIO_ATT

  • Reply Stream:
    GET_ADC_READING Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 GPIO_ADC 0 0 0 0 0 GPIO_ADC[10:8]
    0x02 GPIO_ADC[7:0]
    0x03 BATTERY_ADC 0 0 0 0 0 BATTERY_ADC[10:8]
    0x04 BATTERY_ADC[7:0]
    0x05 TEMP_ADC 0 0 0 0 0 TEMP_ADC[10:8]
    0x06 TEMP_ADC[7:0]
    0x07 TEMP_SLOPE TEMP_SLOPE
    0x08 TEMP_INTERCEPT TEMP_INTERCEPT

  • Argument Fields:
    • ADC_EN
      • TEMPERATURE_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_00
        • Do not perform ADC conversion of the temperature. The reply value in TEMP_ADC will always be 0x000.
        ENUM_11
        • Perform ADC conversion of the temperature. The reply value in TEMP_ADC will be TEMP(degC) = (899/4096)*TEMP_ADC - 293.
        Comments:
        • Perform ADC conversion of the temperature. The reply value in TEMP_ADC will be TEMP(degC) = ((800 + TEMP_SLOPE)/4096) * TEMP_ADC - (TEMP_INTERCEPT/2 + 256), where TEMP_SLOPE and TEMP_INTERCEPT are defined in the OTP variable space (and also returned in the GET_ADC_READING reply stream).
      • BATTERY_VOLTAGE_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_00
        • Do not perform ADC conversion of the battery voltage. The reply value in BATTERY_ADC will always be 0x000.
        ENUM_11
        • Perform ADC conversion of the battery voltage. The reply value in BATTERY_ADC will be VBAT(V) = 3*BATTERY_ADC/1280.
      • ADC_GPIO_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_00
        • Do not perform ADC conversion of the voltage applied to the selected GPIO pin. The reply value in GPIO_ADC will always be 0x000.
        ENUM_11
        • Perform ADC conversion of the voltage applied to the selected GPIO pin. The reply value in GPIO_ADC will be VGPIO(V) = GPIO_ADC/GPIO_ADC_DIV, where GPIO_ADC_DIV is an attenuation factor defined by the selection of the GPIO_ATT parameter.
      • ADC_GPIO_PIN
        Description:
        • Select the GPIO pin on which to perform conversion of an externally applied voltage.
        • The selected GPIO pin must also be configured as an input pin or tri-state pin (through use of the GPIO_PIN_CFG command).
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_00
        • The voltage on GPIO0 will be converted by the ADC.
        ENUM_11
        • The voltage on GPIO1 will be converted by the ADC.
        ENUM_22
        • The voltage on GPIO2 will be converted by the ADC.
        ENUM_33
        • The voltage on GPIO3 will be converted by the ADC.
    • ADC_CFG
      • UDTIME
        Description:
        • Selects the rate of ADC conversion, where ADC_RATE = SYS_CLK / 12 / 2^(UDTIME + 1). Selecting shorter conversion times (i.e., faster conversion rates) will result in lower ADC resolution and longer conversion times will result in higher ADC resolution.
        • An ADC conversion rate of 305 Hz (UDTIME = 0xC) to 1.22 kHz (UDTIME = 0xA) is recommended.
        • If the ADC_CFG parameter byte is not sent, or is set ADC_CFG = 0x00, the UDTIME parameter will assume a default value of 0xC = 305 Hz ADC conversion rate (for nominal SYS_CLK = 30 MHz).
        Type:
        U8
      • GPIO_ATT
        Description:
        • Selects the attenuation factor to be internally applied to the voltage on the GPIO pin, prior to conversion by the ADC. This effectively extends the range of voltages which may be converted.
        • If the ADC_CFG parameter byte is not sent, or is set ADC_CFG = 0x00, the GPIO_ATT parameter will assume a default value of 0x5 = 0 to 3.2V range.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        0P80
        • ADC measurement range is 0 to 0.8 V. GPIO_ADC_DIV = 2560.
        1P64
        • ADC measurement range is 0 to 1.6 V. GPIO_ADC_DIV = 1280.
        3P25
        • ADC measurement range is 0 to 3.2 V. GPIO_ADC_DIV = 640.
        2P48
        • ADC measurement range is 0 to 2.4 V. GPIO_ADC_DIV = 853.33.
        3P69
        • ADC measurement range is 0 to 3.6 V. GPIO_ADC_DIV = 426.66.
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • GPIO_ADC
      • GPIO_ADC
        Description:
        • Returns the voltage on the selected GPIO pin, as converted by the Auxiliary ADC.
        • The reply value will be VGPIO(V) = GPIO_ADC/GPIO_ADC_DIV, where GPIO_ADC_DIV is an attenuation factor defined by the selection of the GPIO_ATT parameter.
        Type:
        U16
    • BATTERY_ADC
      • BATTERY_ADC
        Description:
        • Returns the battery voltage, as converted by the Auxiliary ADC.
        • The reply value will be VBAT(V) = 3*BATTERY_ADC/1280.
        Type:
        U16
    • TEMP_ADC
      • TEMP_ADC
        Description:
        • Returns the temperature, as converted by the Auxiliary ADC.The reply value will be TEMP(degC) = (899/4096)*TEMP_ADC - 293.
        Type:
        U16
    • TEMP_SLOPE
      • TEMP_SLOPE
        Description:
        • Slope in the equation that relates the converted TEMP_ADC value to the corresponding temperature (i.e., TEMP_degC = SLOPE*TEMP_ADC + INTERCEPT).
        • The TEMP_SLOPE value returned in the reply stream for GET_ADC_READING is defined by an OTP variable (OTP_VARS_AUXADC_TEMP_SLOPE) and thus provides for factory calibration of the temperature sensor performance, if desired.
        Type:
        U8
    • TEMP_INTERCEPT
      • TEMP_INTERCEPT
        Description:
        • Intercept in the equation that relates the converted TEMP_ADC value to the corresponding temperature (i.e., TEMP_degC = SLOPE*TEMP_ADC + INTERCEPT).
        • The TEMP_INTERCEPT value returned in the reply stream for GET_ADC_READING is defined by an OTP variable (OTP_VARS_AUXADC_TEMP_INTERCEPT) and thus provides for factory calibration of the temperature sensor performance, if desired.
        Type:
        U8

PROTOCOL_CFG

  • Number: 0x18
  • Summary: Sets the chip up for specified protocol.
  • Purpose:
  • Argument Stream:
    PROTOCOL_CFG Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x18
    0x01 PROTOCOL PROTOCOL

  • Reply Stream:
    PROTOCOL_CFG Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • PROTOCOL
      • PROTOCOL
        Description:
        • Selects which protocol to configure the chip for.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        GENERIC0
        • Packet format is generic, no dynamic reprogramming of packet handler properties.
        IE154G1
        • Packet format is IEEE802.15.4g compliant. The following properties are overriden: PKT_CRC_CONFIG, CRC_ENDIAN/BIT_ORDER in PKT_CONFG1 for TX and RX, PKT_FIELD_1_CRC_CONFIG for RX. Other applicable properties in the packet handler group still need to be programmed. Field 1 should have the length of 16 bits to contain the PHR with PKT_LEN_FIELD_SOURCE set to 1 for RX. PSDU field shall use Field 2 with variable length. Field 2 length should be set to the maximum allowed including the anticipated FCS length. It is anticipated that the FCS will be calculated by the host and transmitted over the air. PHR and FCS will be put in the FIFO for the host to retrieve and check. Therefore, CRC shouldn't be enabled.
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

GET_PH_STATUS

  • Number: 0x21
  • Summary: Returns the interrupt status of the Packet Handler Interrupt Group (both STATUS and PENDING). Optionally, it may be used to clear latched (PENDING) interrupt events.
  • Purpose:
    • Returns the current interrupt status of Packet Handler interrupt events (both STATUS and PENDING) and optionally clears PENDING interrupts.
    • Please refer to the GET_INT_STATUS command for more details regarding the difference between STATUS and PENDING interrupts.
    • Sending the GET_PH_STATUS command with NO input parameter results in clearing all of the PENDING interrupts.
    • When PENDING interrupts are being cleared, the reply stream reflects their status prior to clearing.
  • Argument Stream:
    GET_PH_STATUS Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x21
    0x01 PH_CLR_PEND FILTER_MATCH_PEND_CLR FILTER_MISS_PEND_CLR PACKET_SENT_PEND_CLR PACKET_RX_PEND_CLR CRC_ERROR_PEND_CLR ALT_CRC_ERROR_PEND_CLR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR

  • Reply Stream:
    GET_PH_STATUS Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 PH_PEND FILTER_MATCH_PEND FILTER_MISS_PEND PACKET_SENT_PEND PACKET_RX_PEND CRC_ERROR_PEND ALT_CRC_ERROR_PEND TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND
    0x02 PH_STATUS FILTER_MATCH FILTER_MISS PACKET_SENT PACKET_RX CRC_ERROR ALT_CRC_ERROR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL

  • Argument Fields:
    • PH_CLR_PEND
      • FILTER_MATCH_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending FILTER_MATCH interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FILTER_MISS_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending FILTER_MISS interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_SENT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending PACKET_SENT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_RX_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending PACKET_RX interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CRC_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CRC_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • ALT_CRC_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending ALT_CRC_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • PH_PEND
      • FILTER_MATCH_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the FILTER_MATCH status bit has been detected and therefore a FILTER_MATCH interrupt is pending. See associated FILTER_MATCH status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FILTER_MISS_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the FILTER_MISS status bit has been detected and therefore a FILTER_MISS interrupt is pending. See associated FILTER_MISS status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_SENT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the PACKET_SENT status bit has been detected and therefore a PACKET_SENT interrupt is pending. See associated PACKET_SENT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_RX_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the PACKET_RX status bit has been detected and therefore a PACKET_RX interrupt is pending. See associated PACKET_RX status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CRC_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CRC_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a CRC_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated CRC_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • ALT_CRC_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the ALT_CRC_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a ALT_CRC_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated ALT_CRC_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt is pending. See associated TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt is pending. See associated RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • PH_STATUS
      • FILTER_MATCH
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the incoming packet matched filter. Cleared upon entry into RX state, or if RX is restarted.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FILTER_MISS
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the incoming packet was discarded because filter did not match. Cleared upon entry into RX state, or if RX is restarted.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_SENT
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that data bytes in the TX FIFO were transmitted successfully. Cleared upon entry into TX state.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • PACKET_RX
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the expected number of data bytes have been successfully received and placed in the RX FIFO. All enabled Packet Handler functions (e.g., CRC check, Filter Matching) must be successfully completed in order to generate a PACKET_RX interrupt.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CRC_ERROR
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the received CRC checksum byte(s) do not match the calculated CRC checksum value. Cleared upon entry into RX state or if RX is restarted.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • ALT_CRC_ERROR
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the received CRC checksum byte(s) do not match the calculated alternate CRC checksum value. For the difference between the two CRC engines (CRC, ALT_CRC), see PKT_CRC_CONFIG property. Cleared upon entry into RX state or if RX is restarted.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the amount of space in the TX FIFO is equal to or greater than the PKT_TX_THRESHOLD value. This interrupt may be used to signal the host MCU to store more data bytes into the TX FIFO, thus providing a means for handling packets with lengths greater than the size of the TX FIFO (i.e., 64 bytes, or 129 bytes in shared FIFO mode). Cleared if the amount of space in the TX FIFO is more than the PKT_TX_THRESHOLD value.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the number of bytes stored in the RX FIFO is equal to or greater than the PKT_RX_THRESHOLD value. This interrupt may be used to signal the host MCU to read more data bytes from the RX FIFO, thus providing a means for handling packets with lengths greater than the size of the RX FIFO (i.e., 64 bytes, or 129 bytes in shared FIFO mode). Cleared if the amount of data in the RX FIFO is less than the PKT_RX_THRESHOLD value.
        Type:
        BOOL

GET_CHIP_STATUS

  • Number: 0x23
  • Summary: Returns the interrupt status of the Chip Interrupt Group (both STATUS and PENDING). Optionally, it may be used to clear latched (PENDING) interrupt events.
  • Purpose:
    • Returns the current interrupt status of Chip interrupt events (both STATUS and PENDING) and optionally clears PENDING interrupts.
    • Please refer to the GET_INT_STATUS command for more details regarding the difference between STATUS and PENDING interrupts.
    • Sending the GET_CHIP_STATUS command with NO input parameter results in clearing all of the PENDING interrupts.
    • When PENDING interrupts are being cleared, the reply stream reflects their status prior to clearing.
  • Argument Stream:
    GET_CHIP_STATUS Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x23
    0x01 CHIP_CLR_PEND 0 CAL_PEND_CLR FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND_CLR STATE_CHANGE_PEND_CLR CMD_ERROR_PEND_CLR CHIP_READY_PEND_CLR LOW_BATT_PEND_CLR WUT_PEND_CLR

  • Reply Stream:
    GET_CHIP_STATUS Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 CHIP_PEND 0 CAL_PEND FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND STATE_CHANGE_PEND CMD_ERROR_PEND CHIP_READY_PEND LOW_BATT_PEND WUT_PEND
    0x02 CHIP_STATUS 0 CAL FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR STATE_CHANGE CMD_ERROR CHIP_READY LOW_BATT WUT
    0x03 CMD_ERR_STATUS CMD_ERR_STATUS
    0x04 CMD_ERR_CMD_ID CMD_ERR_CMD_ID
    0x05 INFO_FLAGS 0 0 0 0 0 0 CAL_TYPE 0

  • Argument Fields:
    • CHIP_CLR_PEND
      • CAL_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CAL interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending STATE_CHANGE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CMD_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CHIP_READY interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending LOW_BATT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending WUT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • CHIP_PEND
      • CAL_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CAL status bit has been detected and therefore a CAL interrupt is pending. See associated CAL status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the STATE_CHANGE status bit has been detected and therefore a STATE_CHANGE interrupt is pending. See associated STATE_CHANGE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CMD_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a CMD_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated CMD_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CHIP_READY status bit has been detected and therefore a CHIP_READY interrupt is pending. See associated CHIP_READY status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the LOW_BATT status bit has been detected and therefore a LOW_BATT interrupt is pending. See associated LOW_BATT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the WUT status bit has been detected and therefore a WUT interrupt is pending. See associated WUT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • CHIP_STATUS
      • CAL
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate a RC32K calibration event is pending. If this occurs, the RC32K oscillator will be calibrated on the next transition to Sleep/Standby state.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the number of received or transmitted bytes exceeds the size of the RX or TX FIFO, respectively (i.e., 64 bytes for each FIFO, or 129 bytes when sharing the FIFO). Upon such an underflow/overflow event, the FIFO(s) will need to be reset. Cleared by issuing a FIFO_INFO command to reset the FIFOs.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE
        Description:
        • Set to indicate a successful transition from one state to another operating state. Cleared when a state transition is in progress.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate an error has occurred in the processing of a command. For example, an incorrect command/property ID is sent, or an attempt was made to write a property that is outside of the given property group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the chip (upon completion of the POWER_UP sequence) has reached the state where it is ready to accept commands, or when the IR calibration process is completed. Cleared when the chip is shutdown or when IR calibration has begun.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the battery voltage is below the threshold set by GLOBAL_LOW_BATT_THRESH . Cleared to indicate the battery voltage is above the threshold set by GLOBAL_LOW_BATT_THRESH .
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate the WUT (Wake-up timer) has expired.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • CMD_ERR_STATUS
      • CMD_ERR_STATUS
        Description:
        • Last command error cause. Only valid if CMD_ERROR status bit is set.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        CMD_ERROR_NONE0
        • No error.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_COMMAND16
        • Bad command issued.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_ARG17
        • Argment(s) in issued command were invalid.
        CMD_ERROR_COMMAND_BUSY18
        • Command was issued before previous command was completed.
        CMD_ERROR_INVALID_STATE19
        • Command issued was not allowed while in the current device state.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_NVM32
        • Bad NVM detected.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_PATCH48
        • Bad patch detected.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_BOOTMODE49
        • Invalid bootmode supplied.
        CMD_ERROR_BAD_PROPERTY64
        • Bad Property ID was provided.
        CMD_ERROR_INTERNAL_PH_FIFO240
        • Occurs when the internal packet handler FIFOs underflow or overflow. Can be caused by a user FIFO underflow on TX or the firmware not keeping up with the datarate.
    • CMD_ERR_CMD_ID
      • CMD_ERR_CMD_ID
        Description:
        • Command ID that was being proccessed at the time of the last command error.
        Type:
        Enumeration
    • INFO_FLAGS
      • CAL_TYPE
        Description:
        • Defines which calibration is required.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        OFFLINE_CAL0
        • Offline calibration.
        OFFLINE2_CAL1
        • Offline2 calibration.

IE154_COMMANDS

IE154_START_TX

  • Number: 0x80
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Transitions to complete and fail states not fully tested Needs argument (cca backoff time) clean-up Starts transmission using 802.15.4 parameters
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Transitions to complete and fail states not fully tested Needs argument (cca backoff time) clean-up Starts transmission using 802.15.4 parameters.
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Transitions to complete and fail states not fully tested Needs argument (cca backoff time) clean-up
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_START_TX Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x80
    0x01 OPTIONS 0 WAIT_FOR_ACK 0 0 0 NUM_CCA_CHECKS
    0x02 NETWORK_INDEX NETWORK_INDEX
    0x03 NEXT_MODE TX_FAIL_MODE TX_COMPLETE_MODE

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_START_TX Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • OPTIONS
      • WAIT_FOR_ACK
        Description:
        • Wait for acknowledge after transmission
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DONT_WAIT0
        • Don't wait for Acknowledge after transmission
        WAIT1
        • Wait for Acknowledge after transmission
      • NUM_CCA_CHECKS
        Description:
        • Number of backoff periods used on CSMA-CA
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0x5
    • NETWORK_INDEX
      • NETWORK_INDEX
        Description:
        • Network index, used to specify transmit parameters like channel and power
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0x3
    • NEXT_MODE
      • TX_FAIL_MODE
        Description:
        • Next mode if operation fails
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        SLEEP1
        • Switch to sleep mode
        IDLE2
        • Switch to idle mode
        LISTEN3
        • Switch to listen mode
      • TX_COMPLETE_MODE
        Description:
        • Next mode if operation succeeds
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        SLEEP1
        • Switch to sleep mode
        IDLE2
        • Switch to idle mode
        LISTEN3
        • Switch to listen mode
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_START_RX

  • Number: 0x81
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Need to test transitions to "rx_complete" modes Starts reception using 802.15.4 parameters
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Need to test transitions to "rx_complete" modes Starts reception using 802.15.4 parameters.
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented. Need to test transitions to "rx_complete" modes
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_START_RX Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x81
    0x01 CHANNEL CHANNEL
    0x02 NEXT_MODE 0 0 0 0 RX_COMPLETE_MODE

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_START_RX Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • CHANNEL
      • CHANNEL
        Description:
        • Channel ID
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xff
    • NEXT_MODE
      • RX_COMPLETE_MODE
        Description:
        • Next mode if operation succeeds
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        SLEEP1
        • Switch to sleep mode
        IDLE2
        • Switch to idle mode
        LISTEN3
        • Switch to RX mode
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_GET_INT_STATUS

  • Number: 0x82
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and tested Obtains the status of the all operations
  • Purpose:
    • Obtains the status of all operations
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_GET_INT_STATUS Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x82
    0x01 IE154_TX_CLR_PEND TX_ERROR_PEND_CLR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND_CLR TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND_CLR TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR TX_SFD_SENT_PEND_CLR
    0x02 IE154_RX_CLR_PEND RX_ERROR_PEND_CLR RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR RX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND_CLR RX_SFD_PEND_CLR
    0x03 IE154_CHIP_CLR_PEND 0 CAL_PEND_CLR FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND_CLR STATE_CHANGE_PEND_CLR CMD_ERROR_PEND_CLR CHIP_READY_PEND_CLR LOW_BATT_PEND_CLR WUT_PEND_CLR

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_GET_INT_STATUS Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 IE154_INT_PEND 0 0 0 0 0 CHIP_INT_PEND RX_MODE_INT_PEND TX_MODE_INT_PEND
    0x02 IE154_INT_STATUS 0 0 0 0 0 CHIP_INT_STATUS RX_MODE_INT_STATUS TX_MODE_INT_STATUS
    0x03 IE154_TX_PEND TX_ERROR_PEND TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND TX_COMPLETE_PEND TX_SFD_SENT_PEND
    0x04 IE154_TX_STATUS TX_ERROR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP TX_COMPLETE TX_SFD_SENT
    0x05 IE154_RX_PEND RX_ERROR_PEND RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND RX_COMPLETE_PEND RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND RX_SFD_PEND
    0x06 IE154_RX_STATUS RX_ERROR RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE RX_COMPLETE RX_SRC_ADDR RX_SFD
    0x07 IE154_CHIP_PEND 0 CAL_PEND FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND STATE_CHANGE_PEND CMD_ERROR_PEND CHIP_READY_PEND LOW_BATT_PEND WUT_PEND
    0x08 IE154_CHIP_STATUS 0 CAL FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR STATE_CHANGE CMD_ERROR CHIP_READY LOW_BATT WUT
    0x09 IE154_TX_ERR_STATUS TX_FIFO_UNDERFLOW 0 0 0 TX_CCA_CANCELLED TX_ABORTED TX_ACK_EXPIRED TX_CCA_FAIL
    0x0a IE154_RX_ERR_STATUS RX_OVERFLOW 0 0 0 0 RX_ABORTED RX_ACK_TX_FAILED 0
    0x0b TX_FIFO_SPACE TX_FIFO_SPACE
    0x0c RX_FIFO_COUNT RX_FIFO_COUNT

  • Argument Fields:
    • IE154_TX_CLR_PEND
      • TX_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_SFD_SENT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_SFD_SENT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_RX_CLR_PEND
      • RX_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_SRC_ADDR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SFD_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_SFD interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_CHIP_CLR_PEND
      • CAL_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CAL interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending STATE_CHANGE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CMD_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending CHIP_READY interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending LOW_BATT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending WUT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_INT_PEND
      • CHIP_INT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, an enabled CHIP_PEND bit is set indicating an interrupt is pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:CHIP_STATUS field for the triggering events within the Chip Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_MODE_INT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, an enabled RX_MODE_PEND bit is set indicating an interrupt is pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:RX_MODE_STATUS field for the triggering events within the RX Mode Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_MODE_INT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, an enabled TX_MODE_PEND bit is set indicating an interrupt is pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:TX_MODE_STATUS field for the triggering events within the TX Mode Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_INT_STATUS
      • CHIP_INT_STATUS
        Description:
        • If set, the Chip Interrupt group has an interrupt pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:CHIP_STATUS field for the triggering events within the Chip Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_MODE_INT_STATUS
        Description:
        • If set, the RX Mode Interrupt group has an interrupt pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:RX_MODE_STATUS field for the triggering events within the RX Mode Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_MODE_INT_STATUS
        Description:
        • If set, the TX Mode Interrupt group has an interrupt pending. See the GET_INT_STATUS:TX_MODE_STATUS field for the triggering events within the TX Mode Interrupt group.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_TX_PEND
      • TX_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt is pending. See associated TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated TX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_SFD_SENT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_SFD_SENT status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_SFD_SENT interrupt is pending. See associated TX_SFD_SENT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_TX_STATUS
      • TX_ERROR
        Description:
        • TX failed because the transmission was aborted
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY
        Description:
        • TX FIFO has dropped below threshold in 802.15.4g-2012 mode
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was received with the frame pending bit set
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was received without the frame pending bit set
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • TX completed. CRC bytes have been sent.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_SFD_SENT
        Description:
        • TX SFD just sent (interrupt right after sending SFD)
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_RX_PEND
      • RX_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated RX_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt is pending. See associated RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated RX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_SRC_ADDR status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_SRC_ADDR interrupt is pending. See associated RX_SRC_ADDR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SFD_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_SFD status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_SFD interrupt is pending. See associated RX_SFD status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_RX_STATUS
      • RX_ERROR
        Description:
        • An Rx error occurred. The specific error(s) can be found in the error status reply
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
        Description:
        • RX FIFO has gone above threshold in 802.15.4g-2012 mode
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • ACK sent for RX - used to terminate data poll
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • Packet fully received and CRC ok
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_SRC_ADDR
        Description:
        • Source address has been received on filtered packet and optionally (per property above) TODO: ADD LINK packet requests ACK
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_SFD
        Description:
        • SFD received on Rx packet (posted for all packets regardless of filtering)
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_CHIP_PEND
      • CAL_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CAL status bit has been detected and therefore a CAL interrupt is pending. See associated CAL status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the STATE_CHANGE status bit has been detected and therefore a STATE_CHANGE interrupt is pending. See associated STATE_CHANGE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CMD_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a CMD_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated CMD_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the CHIP_READY status bit has been detected and therefore a CHIP_READY interrupt is pending. See associated CHIP_READY status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the LOW_BATT status bit has been detected and therefore a LOW_BATT interrupt is pending. See associated LOW_BATT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the WUT status bit has been detected and therefore a WUT interrupt is pending. See associated WUT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_CHIP_STATUS
      • CAL
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate a RC32K calibration event is pending. If this occurs, the RC32K oscillator will be calibrated on the next transition to Sleep/Standby state.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR
        Description:
        • Set to indicate that the number of received or transmitted bytes exceeds the size of the RX or TX FIFO, respectively (i.e., 64 bytes for each FIFO, or 129 bytes when sharing the FIFO). Upon such an underflow/overflow event, the FIFO(s) will need to be reset. Cleared by issuing a FIFO_INFO command to reset the FIFOs.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • STATE_CHANGE
        Description:
        • Set to indicate a successful transition from one state to another operating state. Cleared when a state transition is in progress.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CMD_ERROR
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate an error has occurred in the processing of a command. For example, an incorrect command/property ID is sent, or an attempt was made to write a property that is outside of the given property group.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • CHIP_READY
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the chip (upon completion of the POWER_UP sequence) has reached the state where it is ready to accept commands, or when the IR calibration process is completed. Cleared when the chip is shutdown or when IR calibration has begun.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • LOW_BATT
        Description:
        • Set to indicate the battery voltage is below the threshold set by GLOBAL_LOW_BATT_THRESH . Cleared to indicate the battery voltage is above the threshold set by GLOBAL_LOW_BATT_THRESH .
        Type:
        BOOL
      • WUT
        Description:
        • Self clearing signal that pulses high to indicate the WUT (Wake-up timer) has expired.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_TX_ERR_STATUS
      • TX_FIFO_UNDERFLOW
        Description:
        • A TX FIFO underflow occurred during the transmission of the packet
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_CCA_CANCELLED
        Description:
        • CCA for the transmit has been cancelled. The fifo is untounched and the transmit operation is canceled.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ABORTED
        Description:
        • Transmit of a packet has been aborted. There is possibly a partial packet in the TX FIFO.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_EXPIRED
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was not received on time
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_CCA_FAIL
        Description:
        • TX failed due to CCA check
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_RX_ERR_STATUS
      • RX_OVERFLOW
        Description:
        • RX FIFO overflow
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ABORTED
        Description:
        • RX packet was aborted. There is possibly a partial packet in the fifo that should be discarded.
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ACK_TX_FAILED
        Description:
        • ACK of RX failed to be sent due to some Tx error
        Type:
        U8
    • TX_FIFO_SPACE
      • TX_FIFO_SPACE
        Description:
        • Amount of space currently available in transmit FIFO.
        Type:
        U8
    • RX_FIFO_COUNT
      • RX_FIFO_COUNT
        Description:
        • Number of bytes avaliable in the receive FIFO.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_GET_TX_STATUS

  • Number: 0x83
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested" Obtains the status of the last Tx operation
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested" Obtains the status of the last Tx operation
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested"
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_GET_TX_STATUS Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x83
    0x01 IE154_TX_CLR_PEND TX_ERROR_PEND_CLR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND_CLR TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND_CLR TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR TX_SFD_SENT_PEND_CLR

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_GET_TX_STATUS Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 IE154_TX_PEND TX_ERROR_PEND TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND TX_COMPLETE_PEND TX_SFD_SENT_PEND
    0x02 IE154_TX_STATUS TX_ERROR TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY 0 0 TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP TX_COMPLETE TX_SFD_SENT
    0x03 IE154_TX_ERR_STATUS TX_FIFO_UNDERFLOW 0 0 0 TX_CCA_CANCELLED TX_ABORTED TX_ACK_EXPIRED TX_CCA_FAIL
    0x04 TX_FIFO_SPACE TX_FIFO_SPACE

  • Argument Fields:
    • IE154_TX_CLR_PEND
      • TX_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_SFD_SENT_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending TX_SFD_SENT interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_TX_PEND
      • TX_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY interrupt is pending. See associated TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP interrupt is pending. See associated TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated TX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • TX_SFD_SENT_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the TX_SFD_SENT status bit has been detected and therefore a TX_SFD_SENT interrupt is pending. See associated TX_SFD_SENT status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_TX_STATUS
      • TX_ERROR
        Description:
        • TX failed because the transmission was aborted
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_FIFO_ALMOST_EMPTY
        Description:
        • TX FIFO has dropped below threshold in 802.15.4g-2012 mode
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_W_FP
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was received with the frame pending bit set
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_RECEIVED_NO_FP
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was received without the frame pending bit set
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • TX completed. CRC bytes have been sent.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_SFD_SENT
        Description:
        • TX SFD just sent (interrupt right after sending SFD)
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_TX_ERR_STATUS
      • TX_FIFO_UNDERFLOW
        Description:
        • A TX FIFO underflow occurred during the transmission of the packet
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_CCA_CANCELLED
        Description:
        • CCA for the transmit has been cancelled. The fifo is untounched and the transmit operation is canceled.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ABORTED
        Description:
        • Transmit of a packet has been aborted. There is possibly a partial packet in the TX FIFO.
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_ACK_EXPIRED
        Description:
        • TX expected ACK and ACK was not received on time
        Type:
        U8
      • TX_CCA_FAIL
        Description:
        • TX failed due to CCA check
        Type:
        U8
    • TX_FIFO_SPACE
      • TX_FIFO_SPACE
        Description:
        • Amount of space currently available in transmit FIFO.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_GET_RX_STATUS

  • Number: 0x84
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully testedObtains the status of the last Rx operation
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully testedObtains the status of the last Rx operation
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_GET_RX_STATUS Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x84
    0x01 IE154_RX_CLR_PEND RX_ERROR_PEND_CLR RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR RX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND_CLR RX_SFD_PEND_CLR

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_GET_RX_STATUS Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 IE154_RX_PEND RX_ERROR_PEND RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND RX_COMPLETE_PEND RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND RX_SFD_PEND
    0x02 IE154_RX_STATUS RX_ERROR RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL 0 0 RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE RX_COMPLETE RX_SRC_ADDR RX_SFD
    0x03 IE154_RX_ERR_STATUS RX_OVERFLOW 0 0 0 0 RX_ABORTED RX_ACK_TX_FAILED 0
    0x04 RX_FIFO_COUNT RX_FIFO_COUNT

  • Argument Fields:
    • IE154_RX_CLR_PEND
      • RX_ERROR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_ERROR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_COMPLETE_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_COMPLETE interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_SRC_ADDR interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SFD_PEND_CLR
        Description:
        • If clear, clear any pending RX_SFD interrupt. If set, leave interrupt pending.
        Type:
        BOOL
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_RX_PEND
      • RX_ERROR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_ERROR status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_ERROR interrupt is pending. See associated RX_ERROR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL interrupt is pending. See associated RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_COMPLETE_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_COMPLETE status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_COMPLETE interrupt is pending. See associated RX_COMPLETE status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SRC_ADDR_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_SRC_ADDR status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_SRC_ADDR interrupt is pending. See associated RX_SRC_ADDR status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
      • RX_SFD_PEND
        Description:
        • If set, a rising edge of the RX_SFD status bit has been detected and therefore a RX_SFD interrupt is pending. See associated RX_SFD status bit for more details.
        Type:
        BOOL
    • IE154_RX_STATUS
      • RX_ERROR
        Description:
        • An Rx error occurred. The specific error(s) can be found in the error status reply
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_FIFO_ALMOST_FULL
        Description:
        • RX FIFO has gone above threshold in 802.15.4g-2012 mode
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ACK_TX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • ACK sent for RX - used to terminate data poll
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_COMPLETE
        Description:
        • Packet fully received and CRC ok
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_SRC_ADDR
        Description:
        • Source address has been received on filtered packet and optionally (per property above) TODO: ADD LINK packet requests ACK
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_SFD
        Description:
        • SFD received on Rx packet (posted for all packets regardless of filtering)
        Type:
        U8
    • IE154_RX_ERR_STATUS
      • RX_OVERFLOW
        Description:
        • RX FIFO overflow
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ABORTED
        Description:
        • RX packet was aborted. There is possibly a partial packet in the fifo that should be discarded.
        Type:
        U8
      • RX_ACK_TX_FAILED
        Description:
        • ACK of RX failed to be sent due to some Tx error
        Type:
        U8
    • RX_FIFO_COUNT
      • RX_FIFO_COUNT
        Description:
        • Number of bytes avaliable in the receive FIFO.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_OVERRIDE_NEXT_ACK

  • Number: 0x85
  • Summary: Used to temporarily modify the behavior for the next ack sent
  • Purpose:
    • The settings for IE154_RX_FLAGS:AUTO_ACK_DEFAULT_VALUE and IE154_RX_FLAGS:FRAME_PENDING_DEFAULT_VALUE are latched upon entering receive mode and control the ability to automatically send an acknowledge as well as the value of the frame pending bit in that ack, respectively. When auto ack is disabled, either by default or using this command, the value of frame pending does not matter as no ack is transmitted. This command is valid after packet reception begins until just before the ack goes out, or more specifically after the source address in the incoming packet has been received until the beginning of preamble transmission for the outgoing ack. Ack behavior after this time are once again controlled by their defaults in IE154_RX_FLAGS .
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, frame pending is tested, auto_ack disable is only partially tested so far.
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_OVERRIDE_NEXT_ACK Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x85
    0x01 SEQUENCE_NUMBER SEQUENCE_NUMBER
    0x02 NEXT 0 0 0 0 0 0 AUTO_ACK FRAME_PENDING

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_OVERRIDE_NEXT_ACK Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 STATUS STATUS
    0x02 EXPECTED_SEQUENCE_NUMBER EXPECTED_SEQUENCE_NUMBER

  • Argument Fields:
    • SEQUENCE_NUMBER
      • SEQUENCE_NUMBER
        Description:
        • The sequence number of the ack to control, which also matches the received packet being acknowledged.
        Type:
        U8
    • NEXT
      • AUTO_ACK
        Description:
        • Override IE154_RX_FLAGS:AUTO_ACK_DEFAULT_VALUE .
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ABORT1
        • Abort the automatic acknowledge, for this packet only.
      • FRAME_PENDING
        Description:
        • New value of the frame pending bit to use in the Frame Control Field of the automatic acknowledge.
        Type:
        U8
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • STATUS
      • STATUS
        Description:
        • return status
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        STATUS_SUCCESS0
        • The operation completed successfully.
        STATUS_ACK_TIMING_INVALID1
        • Command issued at innappropriate time, either after the auto ACK has been sent or before starting to receive a valid packet.
        STATUS_SEQUENCE_NUMBER_INVALID2
        • Command issued at an appropriate time, but with the wrong sequence number.
    • EXPECTED_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
      • EXPECTED_SEQUENCE_NUMBER
        Description:
        • either the current or most recently expected sequence number for this command, will match command argument with a return status of success
        Type:
        U8

IE154_GET_MAC_TIMER

  • Number: 0x86
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented Obtains the 24 bit MAC timer value from the radio
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented Obtains the 24 bit MAC timer value from the radio
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_GET_MAC_TIMER Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x86

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_GET_MAC_TIMER Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 MAC_TIMER_VALUE MAC_TIMER[23:16]
    0x02 MAC_TIMER[15:8]
    0x03 MAC_TIMER[7:0]

  • Argument Fields:
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • MAC_TIMER_VALUE
      • MAC_TIMER
        Description:
        • 24 bit value of the radio MAC timer, one tick per microsecond
        Type:
        U8

IE154_START_ENERGY_DETECT

  • Number: 0x87
  • Summary: Starts energy detect mode. Energy level is placed in FRR_LATCHED_RSSI
  • Purpose:
    • Starts a continuous reading of the average energy detected over the previous eight symbol periods
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_START_ENERGY_DETECT Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x87
    0x01 CONFIG 0 0 0 0 0 LATCH_POINT
    0x02 CHANNEL CHANNEL

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_START_ENERGY_DETECT Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • CONFIG
      • LATCH_POINT
        Description:
        • Point at which to latch energy.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENERGY40
        • Latches energy at 4*Tb after RX is enabled.
        ENERGY81
        • Latches energy at 8*Tb after RX is enabled.
        ENERGY122
        • Latches energy at 12*Tb after RX is enabled.
        ENERGY163
        • Latches energy at 16*Tb after RX is enabled.
        ENERGY204
        • Latches energy at 20*Tb after RX is enabled.
    • CHANNEL
      • CHANNEL
        Description:
        • Channel to obtain energy
        Type:
        U8
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

  • Number: 0x89
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented Returns the clear or busy status of the channel
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented Return CLEAR if channel is clear, BUSY if channel is busy
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_IS_CHANNEL_CLEAR Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x89
    0x01 CHANNEL_STATUS 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 CHANNEL_STATUS

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_IS_CHANNEL_CLEAR Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS

  • Argument Fields:
    • CHANNEL_STATUS
      • CHANNEL_STATUS
        Description:
        • Indicates whether the current channel is clear or busy
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        BUSY0
        • Channel is busy
        CLEAR1
        • Channel is clear
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_QUERY_MODE

  • Number: 0x8a
  • Summary: Returns the current mode and phase of operation
  • Purpose:
    • Returns the current mode and phase of operation
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Not implemented. Need to complete, and probably merge, modes and phases
  • Argument Stream:
    IE154_QUERY_MODE Argument Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CMD 0x8a

  • Reply Stream:
    IE154_QUERY_MODE Reply Stream
    IndexName76543210
    0x00 CTS CTS
    0x01 OPERATING_MODE_PHASE OPERATING_MODE_PHASE[15:8]
    0x02 OPERATING_MODE_PHASE[7:0]
    0x03 REM_CCA_ATTEMPTS REMAINING_CCA_ATTEMPTS

  • Argument Fields:
  • Reply Fields:
    • CTS
      • CTS
        Description:
        • Clear to Send. Indicates that the previous command has completed execution and the response byte stream (if any) is valid. The next command may be sent.
        Type:
        U8
    • OPERATING_MODE_PHASE
      • OPERATING_MODE_PHASE
        Description:
        • Indicates the current radio operating mode
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        IE154_MODE_IDLE512
        • IE154_IDLE_MODE
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_EXIT768
        • IE154_TX_MODE
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_EXIT1024
        • IE154_RX_MODE
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_IDLE1025
        • Waiting for the preamble of an ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_PHY_HDR1026
        • Receiving the Phy Header of the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_FCF1027
        • Receiving the Frame Control Field of the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_SEQ_NUM1028
        • Receiving the Sequence Number of the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_DEST_ADDR1029
        • Receiving the Destination Address of an ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_SRC_ADDR1030
        • Receiving the Source Address of an ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_RECV_PKT1031
        • Receiving the packet payload of the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_XMIT_WAIT_FOR_RAMP1040
        • Waiting for PA to ramp to transmit packet.
        IE154_MODE_TX_PHASE_XMIT_PKT1041
        • Transmitting packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_IDLE769
        • Waiting for the preamble of an packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_PHY_HDR770
        • Receiving the Phy Header of the packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_FCF771
        • Receiving the Frame Control Field of the packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_SEQ_NUM772
        • Receiving the Sequence Number of the packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_DEST_ADDR773
        • Receiving the Destination Address of an packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_MAC_HDR_SRC_ADDR774
        • Receiving the Source Address of an packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_RECV_PKT775
        • Receiving the packet payload of the packet.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_XMIT_WAIT_FOR_RAMP784
        • Waiting for PA to ramp to transmit the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_RX_PHASE_XMIT_PKT785
        • Transmitting the ACK.
        IE154_MODE_CCA_PHASE_TEST_CHANNEL_CLEAR16385
        • IE154_CCA_MODE_PHASE_TEST_CHANNEL_CLEAR
        IE154_MODE_ED_PHASE_ENERGY_DETECT1281
        • IE154_ED_MODE_PHASE_ENERGY_DETECT
    • REM_CCA_ATTEMPTS
      • REMAINING_CCA_ATTEMPTS
        Description:
        • Defines the number of CCA attempts left
        Type:
        U8
