IE154_TX

IE154_TX_FLAGS

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Configure ie154_tx_flags
  • Purpose:
    • TODO
  • Comments (internal):
    • TODO
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_FLAGS
    Index76543210
    0x00 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 ACK_IN_FIFO
    Defaults
    0x00 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_FLAGS
      • ACK_IN_FIFO
        Description:
        • Controls putting received ACK messages in TX mode into the RX FIFO.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DISABLE0
        • Do not put received ACK messages in the RX FIFO.
        ENABLE1
        • Put received ACK messages in the RX FIFO.

IE154_TX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME_SYMBOLS

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x01
  • Summary: Configure TX Mode transition time after sending a packet and starting to receive the ack
  • Purpose:
    • Define the number of symbols before transitioning into RX to receive the ack
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and used to compute ack timeout. Not fully tested
  • Defaults: 0x0c
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME_SYMBOLS
    Index76543210
    0x01 BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME_SYMBOLS
    Defaults
    0x01 0xc

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME_SYMBOLS
      • BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME_SYMBOLS
        Description:
        • Defines TX mode turnaround time in symbols.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_TX_ACK_TIMEOUT

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x02 ... 0x03
  • Summary: Configure the number of symbols for ack timeout.
  • Purpose:
    • Define the number of symbols to wait for an ack before timing out.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Implemented and tested.
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0xff
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_ACK_TIMEOUT
    Index76543210
    0x02 ACK_TIMEOUT_SYMBOLS[15:8]
    0x03 ACK_TIMEOUT_SYMBOLS[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x02 0x0
    0x03 0xff

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_ACK_TIMEOUT
      • ACK_TIMEOUT_SYMBOLS
        Description:
        • Defines the ack timeout value in symbols.
        Type:
        U16

IE154_TX_CCA_MODE

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x04
  • Summary: TX Mode CCA configuration.
  • Purpose:
    • Configure CCA operation.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Not implemented and not tested.
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_CCA_MODE
    Index76543210
    0x04 0 0 0 0 0 0 0 CCA_METHOD
    Defaults
    0x04 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_CCA_MODE
      • CCA_METHOD
        Description:
        • Configure CCA algorithm to Listen Before Talk
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        CSMA_CA0
        • Configure CCA algorithm to CSMA_CA
        LBT1
        • Configure CCA algorithm to Listen Before Talk

IE154_TX_CCA_THRESHOLD

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x05
  • Summary: Configure CCA Threshold
  • Purpose:
    • CCA Threshold in dBm units
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and tested
  • Defaults: 0x50
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_CCA_THRESHOLD
    Index76543210
    0x05 CCA_THRESHOLD
    Defaults
    0x05 0x50

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_CCA_THRESHOLD
      • CCA_THRESHOLD
        Description:
        • Sets theCCA Threshold in dBm units.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x06 ... 0x07
  • Summary: Define the base number of symbols for the CSMA backoff.
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines the base number of symbols for the CSMA backoff array.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Implemented and tested. Possibility to overflow the timer. Firmware calculation is the following: (IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS * IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF * MODEM_XTAL_TICK_PER_SYMBOL / 256) < 2^12. 12 bits of timer, 256 xtal ticks/ timer tick. Only the lower 8 bits are currently supported.
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0x14
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS
    Index76543210
    0x06 CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS[15:8]
    0x07 CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x06 0x0
    0x07 0x14

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS
      • CSMA_BACKOFF_BASE_SYMBOLS
        Description:
        • Base number of symbols for CSMA backoff.
        Type:
        U16

IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x08 ... 0x11
  • Summary: Configure the range of CSMA backoff for five attempts.
  • Purpose:
    • Defines the CSMA backoff min and max times for five attempts. The CSMA backoff then randomized between the min and max value. The resultant value is multipled by the value of ie154_tx_csma_backoff_base_symbols to define the number of backoff symbols.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Implemented and tested.
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0x07, 0x00, 0x0f, 0x00, 0x1f, 0x00, 0x1f, 0x00, 0x1f
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF
    Index76543210
    0x08 MIN_0
    0x09 MAX_0
    0x0a MIN_1
    0x0b MAX_1
    0x0c MIN_2
    0x0d MAX_2
    0x0e MIN_3
    0x0f MAX_3
    0x10 MIN_4
    0x11 MAX_4
    Defaults
    0x08 0x0
    0x09 0x7
    0x0a 0x0
    0x0b 0xf
    0x0c 0x0
    0x0d 0x1f
    0x0e 0x0
    0x0f 0x1f
    0x10 0x0
    0x11 0x1f

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_CSMA_BACKOFF
      • MIN_0
        Description:
        • Minimum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MAX_0
        Description:
        • Maximum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MIN_1
        Description:
        • Minimum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MAX_1
        Description:
        • Maximum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MIN_2
        Description:
        • Minimum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MAX_2
        Description:
        • Maximum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MIN_3
        Description:
        • Minimum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MAX_3
        Description:
        • Maximum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MIN_4
        Description:
        • Minimum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16
      • MAX_4
        Description:
        • Maximum backoff time in cca units
        Type:
        U16

IE154_TX_CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x12 ... 0x13
  • Summary: Define the number of symbols to measure RSSI during CCA.
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines the number of symbols used to capture RSSI during CSMA clear channel assessment.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Implemented, and tested.
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0x08
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS
    Index76543210
    0x12 CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS[15:8]
    0x13 CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x12 0x0
    0x13 0x8

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS
      • CSMA_ON_SYMBOLS
        Description:
        • Define the number of symbols to stay in RX to measure RSSI.
        Type:
        U16

IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MIN

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x14
  • Summary: Define the LBT minimum clear time.
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines the minimum value that the channel must be clear for the CCA algorithm Listen Before Talk. This property is defined in milliseconds. The LBT clear time is a random value between the minimum and maximum clear time properties.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Not implemented, not tested.
  • Defaults: 0x05
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MIN
    Index76543210
    0x14 CLEAR_TIME_MIN
    Defaults
    0x14 0x5

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MIN
      • CLEAR_TIME_MIN
        Description:
        • Minimum amount of time the channel must be clear for LBT.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MAX

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x15
  • Summary: Define the LBT maximum clear time.
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines the minimum value that the channel must be clear for the CCA algorithm Listen Before Talk. This property is defined in milliseconds. The LBT clear time is a random value between the minimum and maximum clear time properties.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Not implemented, not tested.
  • Defaults: 0x0a
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MAX
    Index76543210
    0x15 CLEAR_TIME_MAX
    Defaults
    0x15 0xa

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_LBT_CLEAR_TIME_MAX
      • CLEAR_TIME_MAX
        Description:
        • Maximum amount of time the channel must be clear for LBT.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_TX_LBT_TOTAL_TIME

  • Group: 0x60
  • Index: 0x16
  • Summary: Total time to check for a clear channel with the Listen Before Talk algorithm.
  • Purpose:
    • This property defines total time to check for a clear channel with the Listen Before Talk algorithm. A CCA_FAIL interrupt is asserted if the channel is not clear within this time window. This property is defined in milliseconds.
  • Comments (internal):
    • Not implemented, not tested.
  • Defaults: 0x32
  • Register View:
    IE154_TX_LBT_TOTAL_TIME
    Index76543210
    0x16 LBT_TOTAL_TIME
    Defaults
    0x16 0x32

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_TX_LBT_TOTAL_TIME
      • LBT_TOTAL_TIME
        Description:
        • Define the total time to check for a clear channel using LBT.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_RX

IE154_RX_FLAGS

  • Group: 0x61
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Control fields for Rx mode.
  • Purpose:
    • Rx flags
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: frame_pending_default_value: Implemented and tested src_addr_event_with_ack: Implemented and used, not fully tested auto_ack: Implemented, used and tested; Need to correct erroneous time-out notification filtering: Implemented and tested: Short address, extended address, beacon frame, different frame combiations creating ill formed packets for 2006 spec
  • Defaults: 0x13
  • Register View:
    IE154_RX_FLAGS
    Index76543210
    0x00 0 0 FRAME_PENDING_DEFAULT_VALUE SRC_ADDR_EVENT_ONLY_ON_ACK_REQUESTS SRC_ADDR_EVENT_DELAY 0 AUTO_ACK_DEFAULT_VALUE FILTERING
    Defaults
    0x00 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x1

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_RX_FLAGS
      • FRAME_PENDING_DEFAULT_VALUE
        Description:
        • Default value of the frame pending bit in the Frame Control Field of the automatic acknowledge. Can be modified using IE154_OVERRIDE_NEXT_ACK .
        Type:
        U8
      • SRC_ADDR_EVENT_ONLY_ON_ACK_REQUESTS
        Description:
        • Controls source address event when an Acknowledge is requested.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • SRC_ADDR events will only be posted for incoming frames which have the ACK Requested bit set in their Frame Control Field.
        DISABLE0
        • SRC_ADDR events will be posted for all incoming frame with a source address field available to read from the Rx FIFO.
      • SRC_ADDR_EVENT_DELAY
        Description:
        • Controls if the source address event is delayed until the MAC command byte is received.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        NONE0
        • SRC_ADDR events post normally.
        MAC_CMD_BYTE1
        • If a SRC_ADDR event occurs, the event will post one byte later after receiving the MAC command byte.
      • AUTO_ACK_DEFAULT_VALUE
        Description:
        • Controls default auto ACK functionality in RX mode.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • If the packet, passes filtering, requests an ACK, and has a valid CRC, The ACK message is transmitted at the time specified by IE154_RX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME . Before the ACK is transmitted this behavior can be modified using IE154_OVERRIDE_NEXT_ACK
        • After the ACK is transmitted the chip will transition to IE154_START_RX:NEXT_MODE:RX_COMPLETE_MODE .
        DISABLE0
        • Automatic acknowledge will not be transmitted.
        • After packet reception the chip will transition to IE154_START_RX:NEXT_MODE:RX_COMPLETE_MODE .
      • FILTERING
        Description:
        • Controls address filtering functionality in in RX mode.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable address filtering. Packet will be validated based on data length (as defined in IE154_RX_MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE ) FCF, and destination address.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable address filtering. Packet will be validated based on data length (as defined in IE154_RX_MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE ) FCF.
        • This bit does not control auto ack functionality therefore the radio could mistakenly ACK a packet not addressed to it. This feature is controlled by IE154_RX_FLAGS:AUTO_ACK and it is recommended to disable auto ack in this mode.

IE154_RX_FLAGS2

  • Group: 0x61
  • Index: 0x01
  • Summary: Control fields for Rx mode.
  • Purpose:
    • Rx flags 2
  • Comments (internal):
    • Spare byte for future rx flags.
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_RX_FLAGS2
    Index76543210
    0x01 RESERVED
    Defaults
    0x01 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_RX_FLAGS2
      • RESERVED
        Description:
        • Rx flags 2
        Type:
        U8

IE154_RX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME

  • Group: 0x61
  • Index: 0x02
  • Summary: Turnaround time between receiving the packet and transmitting the ack
  • Purpose:
    • Define the turnaround time after receiving a packet and transmitting the ack in symbols.
  • Defaults: 0x0c
  • Register View:
    IE154_RX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME
    Index76543210
    0x02 BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME
    Defaults
    0x02 0xc

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_RX_BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME
      • BACKOFF_TURNAROUND_TIME
        Description:
        • Define the turnaround time after receiving a packet and transmitting the ack in symbols.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_RX_EUI_64

  • Group: 0x61
  • Index: 0x03 ... 0x0a
  • Summary: Configure EUI 64
  • Purpose:
    • Unique identifier for the node
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and tested
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00, 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_RX_EUI_64
    Index76543210
    0x03 EUI_64[63:56]
    0x04 EUI_64[55:48]
    0x05 EUI_64[47:40]
    0x06 EUI_64[39:32]
    0x07 EUI_64[31:24]
    0x08 EUI_64[23:16]
    0x09 EUI_64[15:8]
    0x0a EUI_64[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x03 0x0
    0x04 0x0
    0x05 0x0
    0x06 0x0
    0x07 0x0
    0x08 0x0
    0x09 0x0
    0x0a 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_RX_EUI_64
      • EUI_64
        Description:
        • 64-bit unique identifier
        Type:
        U16

IE154_COMMON

IE154_COMMON_FLAGS

  • Group: 0x62
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: TODO
  • Purpose:
    • TODO
  • Defaults: 0x80
  • Register View:
    IE154_COMMON_FLAGS
    Index76543210
    0x00 FRAME_VERSION_FILTER 0 0 0 0 0 0
    Defaults
    0x00 0x2 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_COMMON_FLAGS
      • FRAME_VERSION_FILTER
        Description:
        • Specifies which 802.15.4 frame version is accepted by the radio when receiving data packets in RX mode and receiving ACK packets in TX mode. This does not specify the frame version that ACKs should be transmitted with. They will inherit the data packet frame version.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        20030
        • Accept only 2003 frame type.
        20061
        • Accept 2006 and 2003 frame types.
        20122
        • Accept 2012, 2006, and 2003 frame types.

IE154_COMMON_PHY_CFG

  • Group: 0x62
  • Index: 0x01
  • Summary: TODO
  • Purpose:
    • TODO
  • Defaults: 0x03
  • Register View:
    IE154_COMMON_PHY_CFG
    Index76543210
    0x01 PHY_VER 0 0 0 0 CODING APPEND_CRC CHECK_CRC
    Defaults
    0x01 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x1

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_COMMON_PHY_CFG
      • PHY_VER
        Description:
        • Determines the coding of recieved and transmitted packets.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        STD0
        • 802.15.4 standard phy
        G1
        • 802.15.4g phy
      • CODING
        Description:
        • Determines the coding of recieved and transmitted packets.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        2FSK0
        • Packet is 2FSK encoded
        4FSK1
        • Packet is 4FSK encoded
      • APPEND_CRC
        Description:
        • Determines whether or not the CRC is appended to the packet
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DONT_APPEND_CRC0
        • Don't append CRC
        APPEND_CRC1
        • Append CRC
      • CHECK_CRC
        Description:
        • Controls auto CRC functionality in RX data packets in RX mode and RX ACK packets in TX mode.
        Comments:
        • Not implemented in ROM4
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enables CRC validation in the transceiver. The CRC will not be placed into the RX FIFO.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable CRC validation in the transceiver. The CRC will be placed into the RX FIFO for host validation.
        • This bit does not control auto ack functionality therefore the radio could mistakenly ACK a crc invalid packet. This feature is controlled by IE154_RX_FLAGS:AUTO_ACK and it is recommended to disable auto ack in this mode.

IE154_COMMON_MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE

  • Group: 0x62
  • Index: 0x02 ... 0x03
  • Summary: Configure maximum allowed payload size. Packets that have a length larger than this value will be filtered out and will not be placed into the RX FIFO.
  • Purpose:
    • Maximum payload size of the packet
  • Comments (internal):
    • Added, not used nor tested
  • Defaults: 0x00, 0x7d
  • Register View:
    IE154_COMMON_MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE
    Index76543210
    0x02 MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE[15:8]
    0x03 MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x02 0x0
    0x03 0x7d

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_COMMON_MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE
      • MAX_PAYLOAD_SIZE
        Description:
        • 16-bit max payload size
        Type:
        U16

IE154_COMMON_MIN_PAYLOAD_SIZE

  • Group: 0x62
  • Index: 0x04
  • Summary: Configure minimum allowed payload size when
  • Purpose:
    • Minimum payload size of the packet when filtering is disabled.
  • Defaults: 0x02
  • Register View:
    IE154_COMMON_MIN_PAYLOAD_SIZE
    Index76543210
    0x04 MIN_PAYLOAD_SIZE
    Defaults
    0x04 0x2

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_COMMON_MIN_PAYLOAD_SIZE
      • MIN_PAYLOAD_SIZE
        Description:
        • Minimum payload size.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_COMMON_XTAL_TICK_PER_SYMBOL

  • Group: 0x62
  • Index: 0x05 ... 0x06
  • Summary: Defines the number of crystal ticks that makes up a symbol time.
  • Purpose:
    • Number of crystal ticks per symbol time
  • Comments (internal):
    • Implemented and tested.
  • Defaults: 0x01, 0x2c
  • Register View:
    IE154_COMMON_XTAL_TICK_PER_SYMBOL
    Index76543210
    0x05 XTAL_TICK_UNITS NUM_XTAL_UNITS_PER_SYM[14:8]
    0x06 NUM_XTAL_UNITS_PER_SYM[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x05 0x0 0x1
    0x06 0x2c

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_COMMON_XTAL_TICK_PER_SYMBOL
      • XTAL_TICK_UNITS
        Description:
        • Xtal tick units.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DIV_10
        • XTAL tick unit time is crystal tick divided by 1.
        DIV_2561
        • XTAL tick unit time is crystal tick divided by 256.
      • NUM_XTAL_UNITS_PER_SYM
        Description:
        • Defines the number of xtal tick units per symbol time.
        Type:
        U16

IE154_INT_CTL

IE154_INT_CTL_ENABLE

  • Group: 0x63
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested tx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested rx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested chip_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested This property provides for global enabling of the three interrupt groups in order to generate HW interrupts at the NIRQ pin.
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested tx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested rx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested chip_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested Enables top-level interrupt sources to generate HW interrupts at the NIRQ pin.
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, not fully tested tx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested rx_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested chip_int_status_en: Implemented, not used nor tested
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_INT_CTL_ENABLE
    Index76543210
    0x00 0 0 0 0 0 CHIP_INT_STATUS_EN RX_INT_STATUS_EN TX_INT_STATUS_EN
    Defaults
    0x00 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_INT_CTL_ENABLE
      • CHIP_INT_STATUS_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DISABLED0
        • Disable pending interrupts in the Chip Status group from asserting nNIRQ.
        ENABLED1
        • Enable pending interrupts in the Chip Status group to assert nNIRQ.
      • RX_INT_STATUS_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DISABLED0
        • Disable pending interrupts in rx mode group from asserting nNIRQ.
        ENABLED1
        • Enable pending interrupts in rx mode group to assert nNIRQ.
      • TX_INT_STATUS_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DISABLED0
        • Disable pending interrupts in tx mode group from asserting nNIRQ.
        ENABLED1
        • Enable pending interrupts in tx mode group to assert nNIRQ.

IE154_INT_CTL_TX_ENABLE

  • Group: 0x63

    Defaults
    0x01 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

IE154_INT_CTL_IE154_CHIP_ENABLE

  • Group: 0x63
  • Index: 0x03
  • Summary: INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, Does not seem to be used for any flag ?? Enable individual interrupt sources within the Chip Interrupt Group to generate a HW interrupt on the NIRQ output pin.
  • Purpose:
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, Does not seem to be used for any flag ?? Enable individual interrupt sources within the Chip Interrupt Group in order to generate a HW interrupt at the NIRQ output pin.
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented, Does not seem to be used for any flag ??
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_INT_CTL_IE154_CHIP_ENABLE
    Index76543210
    0x03 0 CAL_EN FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_EN STATE_CHANGE_EN CMD_ERROR_EN CHIP_READY_EN LOW_BATT_EN WUT_EN
    Defaults
    0x03 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_INT_CTL_IE154_CHIP_ENABLE
      • CAL_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables CAL interrupt on rising edge of CAL status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR interrupt on rising edge of FIFO_UNDERFLOW_OVERFLOW_ERROR status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • STATE_CHANGE_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables STATE_CHANGE interrupt on rising edge of STATE_CHANGE status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • CMD_ERROR_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables CMD_ERROR interrupt on rising edge of CMD_ERROR status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • CHIP_READY_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables CHIP_READY interrupt on rising edge of CHIP_READY status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • LOW_BATT_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables LOW_BATT interrupt on rising edge of LOW_BATT status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8
      • WUT_EN
        Description:
        • If set, Enables WUT interrupt on rising edge of WUT status bit. See the status bits in GET_INT_STATUS for more details on the interrupt sources.
        Type:
        U8

IE154_NETWORK

IE154_NETWORK_COORDINATOR_MASK

  • Group: 0x64
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Configure network coordinator mask
  • Purpose:
    • Defines the coordinator mask used for filtering
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and tested
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    IE154_NETWORK_COORDINATOR_MASK
    Index76543210
    0x00 0 0 0 0 NETWORK3 NETWORK2 NETWORK1 NETWORK0
    Defaults
    0x00 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_NETWORK_COORDINATOR_MASK
      • NETWORK3
        Description:
        • Network 3 is a coordinator
        Type:
        U8
      • NETWORK2
        Description:
        • Network 2 is a coordinator
        Type:
        U8
      • NETWORK1
        Description:
        • Network 1 is a coordinator
        Type:
        U8
      • NETWORK0
        Description:
        • Network 0 is a coordinator
        Type:
        U8

IE154_NETWORK_LIST

  • Group: 0x64
  • Index: 0x01 ... 0x06
  • Summary: Configure PAN ID, node ID and channel ID
  • Purpose:
    • ID of the PAN the node associates to, the corresponding ID of this node and the corresponding channel
  • Comments (internal):
    • INTERNAL STATUS: Implemented and tested group 0. Currently testing channel_power member
  • Defaults: 0xff, 0xff, 0xff, 0xfe, 0x00, 0x0f
  • Register View:
    IE154_NETWORK_LIST
    Index76543210
    0x01 PAN_ID[15:8]
    0x02 PAN_ID[7:0]
    0x03 NODE_ID[15:8]
    0x04 NODE_ID[7:0]
    0x05 CHANNEL
    0x06 0 TX_POWER
    Defaults
    0x01 0xff
    0x02 0xff
    0x03 0xff
    0x04 0xfe
    0x05 0x0
    0x06 0x0 0xf

  • Field Details:
    • IE154_NETWORK_LIST
      • PAN_ID
        Description:
        • 16-bit PAN ID
        Type:
        U16
      • NODE_ID
        Description:
        • 16-bit node ID
        Type:
        U16
      • CHANNEL
        Description:
        • 8 bit channel ID
        Type:
        U16
      • TX_POWER
        Description:
        • 7 bit output power level for the corresponding channel
        Type:
        U16

IE154_NETWORK_LIST

  • Group: 0x64
  • Index: 0x07 ... 0x0c
  • Summary: Configure PAN ID, node ID and channel ID
  • Purpose:
    • ID of the PAN the node associates to, the corresponding ID of this node and the corresponding channel
  • Comments (internal):

    0x09 0xff

    0x0b 0x0

MBUS

MBUS_FRAME

  • Group: 0x70
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Controls data frame format and encoding.
  • Purpose:
    • used to configure mbus
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    MBUS_FRAME
    Index76543210
    0x00 DUMMY CODEC FORMAT
    Defaults
    0x00 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • MBUS_FRAME
      • DUMMY
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        DUMMY_00
        • Used for dummy
      • CODEC
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        RAW0
        • No added encoding or decoding. Data is treated as NRZ.
        MANCHESTER1
        • Transmit data will be manchester encoded before transmit, and decoded after receive.
        3_OF_62
        • Transmit data will be 3/6 encoded before transmit, and decoded after receive.
      • FORMAT
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        FORMAT_RAW0
        • No frame formatting.
        FORMAT_A1
        • Frame format A.
        FORMAT_B2
        • Frame format B.

PTI

PTI_CTL

  • Group: 0xf0
  • Index: 0x00
  • Summary: Packet Trace Interface control fields.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip contains packet trace interface for debugging network protocols. This property controls the behavior of this interface.
  • Defaults: 0x80
  • Register View:
    PTI_CTL
    Index76543210
    0x00 PTI_EN 0 0 0 0 0 0 0
    Defaults
    0x00 0x1 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • PTI_CTL
      • PTI_EN
        Description:
        • Controls global enable of the PTI functionality.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable PTI signal to GPIO. GPIO must be configured using GPIO_PIN_CFG .
        DISABLE0
        • Disable PTI signal to GPIO. GPIO must be configured using GPIO_PIN_CFG .

PTI_BAUD

  • Group: 0xf0
  • Index: 0x01 ... 0x02
  • Summary: Desired baud rate for the PTI interface.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip contains a packet trace interface for network debugging. This data is transmitted to host debugger using a UART connection on a GPIO pin (selected using GPIO_PIN_CFG ). This property sets the baud rate of the packet trace data in 100 baud steps.
  • Defaults: 0x13, 0x88
  • Register View:
    PTI_BAUD
    Index76543210
    0x01 BAUD[15:8]
    0x02 BAUD[7:0]
    Defaults
    0x01 0x13
    0x02 0x88

  • Field Details:
    • PTI_BAUD
      • BAUD
        Description:
        • baud
        Type:
        U16
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xffff

PTI_LOG_EN

  • Group: 0xf0
  • Index: 0x03
  • Summary: Enables what the PTI logs.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip contains packet trace interface for debugging network protocols. This property controls messages that get logged by this interface.
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    PTI_LOG_EN
    Index76543210
    0x03 PWR_STATE_EN RX_EN TX_EN CMD_EN CAL_MAN_EN 0 0 0
    Defaults
    0x03 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • PTI_LOG_EN
      • PWR_STATE_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of radio power state transitions to the packet trace interface.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.
      • RX_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of data packets received over the air.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.
      • TX_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of data packets sent over the air.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.
      • CMD_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of SPI commands processed to the packet trace interface.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.
      • CAL_MAN_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of runtime calibration to the packet trace interface.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.

PTI_LOG_EN_2

  • Group: 0xf0
  • Index: 0x04
  • Summary: Enables what the PTI logs.
  • Purpose:
    • The chip contains packet trace interface for debugging network protocols. This property controls messages that get logged by this interface.
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    PTI_LOG_EN_2
    Index76543210
    0x04 0 0 0 0 0 0 CCA_EN MODE_PHASE_EN
    Defaults
    0x04 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • PTI_LOG_EN_2
      • CCA_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of csma/lbt operations to the packet trace interface.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.
      • MODE_PHASE_EN
        Description:
        • Controls logging of mode phase transitions to the packet trace interface.
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENABLE1
        • Enable Logging to the packet trace interface.
        DISABLE0
        • Disable Logging to the packet trace interface.

OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE_VTR

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x06
  • Summary: VTR calibration enables.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x61
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE_VTR
    Index76543210
    0x06 CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_LADR CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V1P5 CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V3P3 CAL_EN_VTR_SY CAL_EN_VTR_ADC CAL_EN_VTR_TX CAL_EN_VTR_RX CAL_EN_VTR_XO
    Defaults
    0x06 0x0 0x1 0x1 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE_VTR
      • CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_LADR
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR VCO ladr calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V1P5
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR VCO v1p5 calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V3P3
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR VCO v3p3 calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_SY
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR SY calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_ADC
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR ADC calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_TX
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR TX calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_RX
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR RX calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_VTR_XO
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VTR XO calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.

OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x07
  • Summary: Calibration enables.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x45
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE
    Index76543210
    0x07 CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V1P5 CAL_EN_RFPKD_RECAL_ON_WARM CAL_EN_RFPKD_RECAL_ON_RX CAL_EN_RFPKD_FULL CAL_EN_RC_CAL_FOR_ADC CAL_EN_PGA_OFS CAL_EN_RC_CAL_32K CAL_EN_BOOT_OSC
    Defaults
    0x07 0x0 0x1 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x1 0x0 0x1

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_ENABLE
      • CAL_EN_VTR_VCO_V1P5
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform VCO v1p5 calibration on every warm boot.
      • CAL_EN_RFPKD_RECAL_ON_WARM
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform RF peak detector calibration on every warm boot.
      • CAL_EN_RFPKD_RECAL_ON_RX
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform fast RF peak detector calibration on every entry into RX.
      • CAL_EN_RFPKD_FULL
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform full RF peak detector calibration on every warm boot. Full Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_RC_CAL_FOR_ADC
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform rc32k calibration for adc on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.
      • CAL_EN_PGA_OFS
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform pga ofs calibration on every entry into RX.
      • CAL_EN_RC_CAL_32K
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform rc32k calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot and on CAL timer expiration.
      • CAL_EN_BOOT_OSC
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ENUM_01
        • Perform boot osc calibration on every warm boot. Always performed at cold boot.

OTP_VARS_RC_CAL2

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x0f
  • Summary: RC32k calibration parameters.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x42
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_RC_CAL2
    Index76543210
    0x0f HIGH_CURR_CHOP SETTLE_CYCLES
    Defaults
    0x0f 0x1 0x2

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_RC_CAL2
      • HIGH_CURR_CHOP
        Description:
        • Controls chop and high current mode operation. (h)
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        CHOP_DIS_HI_DIS0
        • Chop disabled, High current mode disabled.
        CHOP_EN_HI_DIS1
        • Chop enabled, High current mode disabled.
        CHOP_DIS_HI_EN2
        • Chop disabled, High current mode enabled.
        CHOP_EN_HI_EN3
        • Chop enabled, High current mode enabled.
      • SETTLE_CYCLES
        Description:
        • Number of RC32k cycles to wait for clock to settle after changing frequency and before checking frequency. (ns)
        Type:
        U8

OTP_VARS_BOOT_OSC_CAL

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x10
  • Summary: Boot osc calibration parameters.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x09
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_BOOT_OSC_CAL
    Index76543210
    0x10 XO_CAPCODE_RESTORE_DELAY BOOT_OSC_ADJ
    Defaults
    0x10 0x1 0x1

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_BOOT_OSC_CAL
      • XO_CAPCODE_RESTORE_DELAY
        Description:
        • Delay before restoring XO_CAPCODE.
        Type:
        U8
      • BOOT_OSC_ADJ
        Description:
        • Adjustment value for Boot osc. This value is subtracted from BOSC aconfig register after boot osc calibration. There is an additional adjustment factor applied based on crystal frequency.
        Type:
        U8

OTP_VARS_BOOT_OSC_CAL1

  • Group: 0xf2

        • Delay after restoring capcode, before polling crystal ok.

        U8

      • RFPKD_TH_ETSI_169
        Description:

OTP_VARS_PH_WATERMARK

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x26
  • Summary:
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x42
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_PH_WATERMARK
    Index76543210
    0x26 RX_WATERMARK TX_WATERMARK
    Defaults
    0x26 0x4 0x2

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_PH_WATERMARK
      • RX_WATERMARK
        Description:
        • Selects the high watermark for the packet handler RX fifo. The internal firmware will get interrupted when this is crossed.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x1
        Max:
        0x8
      • TX_WATERMARK
        Description:
        • Selects the low watermark for the packet handler TX fifo. The internal firmware will get interrupted when this is crossed.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x1
        Max:
        0x8

OTP_VARS_VCO_ADJ

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x29
  • Summary:
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_VCO_ADJ
      • V1P5_TX_OFFSET
        Description:
        • This value is added to the calibrated value for the V1P5 regulator while in TX state if MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND:BAND == FVCO/4 || MODEM_CLKGEN_BAND :BAND == FVCO/8.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xf

OTP_VARS_MISC_DELAY

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x2a
  • Summary: Miscellaneous delay values.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x00
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_MISC_DELAY
    Index76543210
    0x2a 0 0 0 0 DEMOD_RST
    Defaults
    0x2a 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_MISC_DELAY
      • DEMOD_RST
        Description:
        • Number of us to delay after turning on the clock to the demod before resetting the demod.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xff

OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x2b
  • Summary: Controls rssi latching and temperature-based calibration enables (cal_man).
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x02
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN
    Index76543210
    0x2b CONTROL_LOOP_EN TEMP_SENSOR_OFFSET_EN 0 0 0 RSSI_FIRST_LATCH_ADJ
    Defaults
    0x2b 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x0 0x2

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN
      • CONTROL_LOOP_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ASSERT1
        • Enable/disable all automatic recalibrations due to temperature change.
      • TEMP_SENSOR_OFFSET_EN
        Type:
        Enumeration
        NameValueDescription
        ASSERT1
        • Uses otp_var_auxadc_sy_offset to determine and account for temperature sensor offset in absolute temperature measurement.
      • RSSI_FIRST_LATCH_ADJ
        Description:
        • Adjust the Tb to wait before the first RSSI latch. Max value is 3 for RSSI updated every bit and 6 for RSSI 4 bit averaged.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xff

  • Index: 0x2c

        Max:
        0x7f

OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_ONLINE_TEMP_DELTA

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x30
  • Summary: Sets limit for online recalibration control loop. A value of 6 equates to 19.16 degrees Celsius.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x06
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_ONLINE_TEMP_DELTA
    Index76543210
    0x30 CAL_MAN_ONLINE_TEMP_DELTA
    Defaults
    0x30 0x6

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_ONLINE_TEMP_DELTA
      • CAL_MAN_ONLINE_TEMP_DELTA
        Description:
        • Temperature sensor divider code difference required to trigger an online recalibration. Setting this to zero causes the radio to continuously recalibrate all blocks every time the 8051 wakes from PCON sleep.
        Type:
        S8
        Min:
        0x-80
        Max:
        0x7f

OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_OFFLINE_TEMP_DELTA

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x31
  • Summary: Sets limit for user interupt meaning it is time to recalibrate offline. A value of 18 equates to 57.49 degrees Celsius.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x12
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_OFFLINE_TEMP_DELTA
    Index76543210
    0x31 CAL_MAN_OFFLINE_TEMP_DELTA
    Defaults
    0x31 0x12

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_OFFLINE_TEMP_DELTA
      • CAL_MAN_OFFLINE_TEMP_DELTA
        Description:
        • Temperature sensor divider code difference required to generate user interrupt
        Type:
        S8
        Min:
        0x-80
        Max:
        0x7f

OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_LOWER_TEMP_TARGET

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x32
  • Summary: Sets limit for switching to use lower temperature settings. A value of 20 equates to 89.39 degrees Celsius.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x14
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_LOWER_TEMP_TARGET
    Index76543210
    0x32 CAL_MAN_LOWER_TEMP_TARGET
    Defaults
    0x32 0x14

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_LOWER_TEMP_TARGET
      • CAL_MAN_LOWER_TEMP_TARGET
        Description:
        • Temperature sensor divider code to switch into using lower temperature range settings
        Type:
        S8
        Min:
        0x-80
        Max:
        0x7f

OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_HIGHER_TEMP_TARGET

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x33
  • Summary: Sets limit for switching to use higher temperature settings. A value of 22 equates to 95.78 degrees Celsius.
  • Purpose:
  • Defaults: 0x16
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_CAL_MAN_HIGHER_TEMP_TARGET
    Index76543210
    0x33 CAL_MAN_HIGHER_TEMP_TARGET

    0x33 0x16

        Description:
        • Temperature sensor divider code to switch into using higher temperature range settings
        Type:
        S8
        Min:
        0x-80
        Max:
        0x7f

OTP_VARS_NVM_TIMING

  • Group: 0xf2
  • Index: 0x34
  • Summary: Configure the timing used when copying out of nvm.
  • Purpose:
    • Configure the timing used when compying out of nvm.
  • Defaults: 0x0b
  • Register View:
    OTP_VARS_NVM_TIMING
    Index76543210
    0x34 0 0 MCU_CLK_PER_100NS
    Defaults
    0x34 0x0 0x0 0xb

  • Field Details:
    • OTP_VARS_NVM_TIMING
      • MCU_CLK_PER_100NS
        Description:
        • Define the number of mcu clock cycles that constitutes a 100ns cycle during the nvm read process.
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0x40

        Description:
        • spare1
        Type:
        U8
        Min:
        0x0
        Max:
        0xff
